summary.para: Returns a waitable handle that signals when the DXGI adapter has finished presenting a new frame.

Windows 8.1 introduces new APIs that allow lower-latency rendering by waiting until the previous frame is presented to the display before drawing the next frame. To use this method, first create the DXGI swap chain with the flag set, then call GetFrameLatencyWaitableObject to retrieve the waitable handle. Use the waitable handle with to synchronize rendering of each new frame with the end of the previous frame. For every frame it renders, the app should wait on this handle before starting any rendering operations. Note that this requirement includes the first frame the app renders with the swap chain. See the DirectXLatency sample. When you are done with the handle, use to close it.

returns.para: A handle to the waitable object, or NULL if the swap chain was not created with .

remarks.para: When an application is finished using the object handle returned by IDXGISwapChain2.GetFrameLatencyWaitableObject, use the function to close the handle.

summary.para: Gets the transform matrix that will be applied to a composition swap chain upon the next present.

Starting with Windows 8.1, Windows Store apps are able to place DirectX swap chain visuals in XAML pages using the SwapChainPanel element, which can be placed and sized arbitrarily. This exposes the DirectX swap chain visuals to touch scaling and translation scenarios using touch UI. The GetMatrixTransform and methods are used to synchronize scaling of the DirectX swap chain with its associated SwapChainPanel element. Only simple scale/translation elements in the matrix are allowed – the call will fail if the matrix contains skew/rotation elements.

param.name: pMatrix
param.para: The transform matrix currently used for swap chain scaling and translation.

item.description: S_OK if it successfully retrieves the transform matrix.
DXGI_ERROR_INVALID_CALL if the method is called on a swap chain that was not created with .
Possibly other error codes that are described in the DXGI_ERROR topic.

summary.para: Gets the source region used for the swap chain.

Use GetSourceSize to get the portion of the swap chain from which the operating system presents. The source rectangle is always defined by the region [0, 0, Width, Height]. Use to set this portion of the swap chain.

param.para: The current width of the source region of the swap chain. This value can range from 1 to the overall width of the swap chain.

summary.para: Sets the source region to be used for the swap chain.

Use SetSourceSize to specify the portion of the swap chain from which the operating system presents. This allows an effective resize without calling the more-expensive method. Prior to Windows 8.1, calling IDXGISwapChain.ResizeBuffers was the only way to resize the swap chain. The source rectangle is always defined by the region [0, 0, Width, Height].

param.name: Width
param.para: Source width to use for the swap chain. This value must be greater than zero, and must be less than or equal to the overall width of the swap chain.

param.name: Height
param.para: Source height to use for the swap chain. This value must be greater than zero, and must be less than or equal to the overall height of the swap chain.

item.description: E_INVALIDARG if one or more parameters exceed the size of the back buffer.
